title: 1D Motion - plane on a runway v from a-vs-t eqn

content.description: An airplane starts at rest on a straight runway. The airplane begins to accelerate. For the first <math alttext="30 seconds" overflow="scroll"> <mn>30</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi> </math> of the airplane’s motion, the magnitude of the airplane’s acceleration <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>a</mi></mstyle></math> is modeled as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> by the equation <math alttext="a, equals beta times t squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>β</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="beta equals, one ninetieth meter per second to the fourth power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>90</mn></mfrac><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mtext>4</mtext></msup></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is the airplane’s speed at <math alttext="t equals 30 seconds" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>30</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi> </math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
